summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of a witness, identified as a former model, who describes being recruited by a party promoter named 'Ghislaine' to meet Jeffrey Epstein at his Upper East Side home in June 2004. The witness details a sexual assault by Epstein during what was presented as a massage session. The document also mentions the witness's interactions with the promoter and the owner of a modeling agency.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the individual who sexually assaulted the witness during a massage session at his Upper East Side home in June 2004. He offered her $300 afterward.

persons.name: Ghislaine
persons.context: A party promoter the witness met at a nightclub. She talked about her friend 'Jeffrey' (Epstein), arranged the meeting at a subway station, and brought the witness to Epstein's home.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: The owner of the MC2 modeling agency. The witness met him at a club, went to his home where there was alcohol and cocaine, and recalls him being 'handsy' with other models.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Present for the witness interview at One Saint Andrews Plaza in New York.

connections.description: Ghislaine described Epstein as her friend who 'loved to help people' and had connections. She recruited the witness for him.
Both were part of the same social and nightclub scene frequented by models. Ghislaine mentioned Brunel's agency to the witness.
Implied connection through the modeling world and the witness's narrative, though not explicitly stated as direct in this document.
Ghislaine met the witness at a club, promoted Epstein, and personally escorted her to Epstein's home for the assault.
Epstein sexually assaulted the witness during a massage at his home after she was recruited by Ghislaine.

events.title: Witness Recruited and Assaulted at Epstein's Home
events.description: The witness, a new model, was recruited by Ghislaine and brought to Jeffrey Epstein's Upper East Side home. Under the guise of a massage, Epstein sexually assaulted her and afterward placed $300 on the table.

events.title: Witness Leaves New York City
events.description: The witness left New York City in October 2004, citing the assault as the reason she turned away from modeling. She never spoke to Epstein again.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness was interviewed by the FBI, with AUSA, Special Agent, and a Detective present, at One Saint Andrews Plaza in New York.

locations: One Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York (FBI interview location)
Jeffrey Epstein's upper east side home, Manhattan, New York
Models apartment on the east side of Manhattan in the 40's next to 'Elite Food Bar'
keyFacts: A witness (former model) describes a June 2004 sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein at his Upper East Side home, facilitated by a party promoter named Ghislaine.
Epstein offered the witness $300 in cash immediately following the assault.
The witness identified a 'tall slim girl... about 19 years old' in Epstein's kitchen as his 'main girlfriend'.
The witness also describes social interactions with Jean-Luc Brunel, owner of the MC2 modeling agency, at his home where there was alcohol and cocaine.
The assault caused the witness to abandon her modeling career and leave New York City by October 2004.
